title: Enhancing Healthcare Practical Skills: Design Thinking-Based Interdisciplinary Collaborative Instructional Design in Elementary Mathematics

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary math education theory and pedagogical knowledge
context.additional_context: Practical competency enhancement program for medical/nursing field practitioners

learning_goals: Acquisition of the ability to design elementary mathematics lessons applying the design thinking process.
Development of the ability to create mathematics activities integrated with other disciplines (e.g., art, engineering).
Cultivation of the ability to improve mathematics teaching and learning materials through iterative prototyping.

Learners analyze 2 clinical cases in ≥3 interdisciplinary collaboration projects (medical staff-nurse-social worker teams) over 6 months, propose team-based solutions, and score ≥80% in ≥2 of 3 rubric items (goal achievement, collaboration efficiency, creativity).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
